ArticleTitle.sentence: CTLA-4-Mediated inhibition of early events of T cell proliferation.

event.clue: CTLA-4-Mediated inhibition of early events of T cell proliferation.

AbstractText.sentence: CTLA-4 engagement by mAbs inhibits, while CD28 enhances, IL-2 production and proliferation upon T cell activation.

AbstractText.sentence: Here, we have analyzed the mechanisms involved in CTLA-4-mediated inhibition of T cell activation of naive CD4+ T cells using Ab cross-linking.

event.clue: Here, we have analyzed the mechanisms involved in CTLA-4-mediated inhibition of T cell activation of naive CD4+ T cells using Ab cross-linking.

AbstractText.sentence: CTLA-4 ligation inhibited CD3/CD28-induced IL-2 mRNA accumulation by inhibiting IL-2 transcription, which appears to be mediated in part through decreasing NF-AT accumulation in the nuclei.

AbstractText.sentence: However, CTLA-4 ligation did not appear to affect the CD28-mediated stabilization of IL-2 mRNA.

AbstractText.sentence: Further, CTLA-4 engagement inhibited progression through the cell cycle by inhibiting the production of cyclin D3, cyclin-dependent kinase (cdk)4, and cdk6 when the T cells were stimulated with anti-CD3/CD28 and with anti-CD3 alone.

AbstractText.sentence: These results indicate that CTLA-4 signaling inhibits events early in T cell activation both at IL-2 transcription and at the level of IL-2-independent events of the cell cycle, and does not simply oppose CD28-mediated costimulation.
